column1: The factor VIII assay is a blood test to measure the activity of factor VIII.
Or, it may be ordered if a family member is known to have hemophilia A.

Decreased factor VIII activity may be due to: - Hemophilia A - Disorder in which the proteins that control blood clotting become over active disseminated intravascular coagulation (DIC) - Presence of a Factor VIII inhibitor (antibody) - Von Willebrand's disease (another type of bleeding disorder) Increased activity may be due to: - Older age - Diabetes - Liver disease - Inflammation - Pregnancy - Obesity
